intro: Scleranthus leucococcus, commonly known as white cockle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is often found in temperate climates. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Scleranthus leucococcus is an annual plant that completes its life cycle within one growing season.
